intro: Parechites borneanus, commonly known as the Bornean parechites, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Borneo. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and related hardwood trees. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically greenish-yellow in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments within lowland and hill forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
